languageTools.program.agent.msc

Class Macro

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.msc.Macro
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MentalFormula, IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class Macro
extends ParsedObject
implements MentalFormula
    A representation of a macro definition:
    #define macroname(arglist) definition
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Macro

        public Macro(java.lang.String name,
     java.util.List<Term> parameters,
     MentalStateCondition definition,
     InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates a new macro definition.
        Parameters:
        name - The name/label of the macro
        parameters - The parameters of the macro (can be the empty list but not null).
        definition - The MentalStateCondition the macro is a shorthand for. If null, this macro reference still needs to be resolved. See RuleValidator.doValidate(languageTools.program.agent.rules.Rule) of Should only be null for macro instances.
        source - The location of the start of the new Macro's definition. May be null if not created by a parser.

      • setDefinition

        public void setDefinition(Macro macro)
                   throws GOALBug
        Sets the definition of this Macro, using the definition provided by the parameter macro.
        Parameters:
        macro - The macro definition used to set the definition for this macro.
        Throws:
        GOALBug - DOC

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed()
        Returns whether this Macro is used in the corresponding agent program. RuleValidators check whether a macro is actually used.
        Returns:
        true if the macro is used in the agent program; false otherwise.

      • markUsed

        public void markUsed()
        Marks this Macro as used, see RuleValidator.doValidate(languageTools.program.agent.rules.Rule).

        public java.util.Set<Var> getFreeVar()
        Specified by:
        getFreeVar in interface MentalFormula
        Returns:
        All free variables in this atom. When this atom is used in a query, these variables are bound.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
